author: Special Correspondent
text:
The two-day national seminar on industrial ergonomics and musculoskeletal disorder organised by the Department of Mechatronics Engineering of K. S. Rangasamy College of Technology here concluded on Saturday.

The event was sponsored by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR), New Delhi. Participants from industries and academic institutions in and around Tamil Nadu participated in the seminar.

Special

lectures

Resource persons from Occupational Health Foundation-Chennai, Steel Authority of India Limited, Salem, Directorate of Industrial Safety and Health and doctors from hospitals delivered special lectures at the sessions on industrial ergonomics, physiological principles, anthropometric factors, workstation design, assessment of musculoskeletal disorder and managing risks.

The seminar was inaugurated by G. Jayaraj, Chairman, Occupational Health Foundation, Chennai. K. S. Rangasamy, Chairman of KSR Group of Institutions, presided and K. Thyagarajah, Principal, offered felicitations.

K. Arul, Additional Director of Industrial Safety and Health, Coimbatore delivered the valedictory address.
title: Seminar concludes
